subject: RE: [junit] Junit 4 custom Runner design

messageBody:
Dear Mike,

I looked at the runner code and I think you could implement both of these
features with custom runners. As the runners are currently implemented, I
think they might both be a challenge. If you try it, I would like to hear
what was easy and what hard. We would like to improve the extensibility of
the runner architecture.

Sincerely yours,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of Mike Norman
> Sent: Thursday, May 04, 2006 8:53 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Junit 4 custom Runner design
>
> From my brief scan of the JUnit4.1 docs, one could create
> a custom Runner using the @RunWith annotation, correct?
>
> I would like to add the following capabilities:
>
> i) parameterize the fixture @BeforeClass/@AfterClass methods:
>
> @BeforeClass
> public static void setupFixtures(Properties p) {
> ...
> }
> The properties would be provided by searching the classpath
> for the resource 'x.y.z.foo.properties' where 'x.y.z' is
> the package of the current testclass and 'foo' is the
> all-lowercase-name of the testclass. The main motivation is
> testing with databases - the various login parameters are
> always changing with new versions of databases we must test
> against (not just Oracle!).
>
> ii) a new runtime Assert called 'ignore("some msg")' to parallel
> the design-time @Ignore annotation. The motivation is (again!)
> testing with databases - we have a numerous tests that run
> against many versions of databases, but each version has their
> own idiosyncratic capabilities - e.g. each vendor handles
> stored-procedures a little different. A test suite may have
> hundreds of tests that pass all db-platforms, but some that only
> pass for known configurations. At runtime the test can
> interrogate the db-fixture and decide to not fail the testcase
> but to ignore it.
>
> Any reason the above behaviour could not be implemented in a
> custom Runner?
>
> Thanks in advance,
> MWN
